alert.note: Alert for Perry (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 23 at 7:43PM CST until February 26 at 2:40PM CST by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Tennessee... Buffalo River Near Lobelville affecting Perry County. For the Buffalo River...including Lobelville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Buffalo River Near Lobelville. * WHEN...Until early Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Flood waters cover Route 438 south of Lobelville near Beardstown and it may be impassable. Extensive agricultural land along the river is flooded as well. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM CST Wednesday the stage was 15.8 feet and rising. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:30 PM CST Wednesday was 15.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 17.0 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.1 feet on 05/15/1967. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday afternoon at 145 PM CST.
